thread.title: This Couple's Disney World Proposal Is A Fairy Tale Come True
thread.title_full: This Couple's Disney World Proposal Is A Fairy Tale Come True

author: Curtis M. Wong
title: This Couple's Disney World Proposal Is A Fairy Tale Come True
text:
This Couple's Disney World Proposal Is A Fairy Tale Come True Here's how Prince Charming found his... Prince Charming üè∞ 02/16/2017 09:29 am ET Curtis M. Wong Queer Voices Senior Editor, The Huffington Post 
When Gregory Anderson decided to propose to his longtime boyfriend, Craig Moss, he knew he wanted the moment to be, in a word, enchanting. With that in mind, he said there was only one location that made absolutely perfect sense: Walt Disney World . 
When Anderson, 28, began dating Moss, 26, he was thrilled to find out that his new boyfriend was just as ‚ÄúDisney obsessed‚Äù as him. The guys visited Walt Disney World for the first time as a couple in 2016 and had an ‚Äúamazing‚Äù time, which inspired Anderson to brainstorm ways to pop the question when they returned to the Florida theme park last month. 
Anderson‚Äôs dream came true, and in a scene that could easily have been lifted from a Disney classic, he dropped to one knee before Moss in front of Cinderella Castle during the couple‚Äôs Jan. 31 visit to the Magic Kingdom. With the help of a Disney cast member, Anderson live-streamed the proposal on Facebook so that friends and family could watch the moment back home. (Watch that video of the proposal above.) Gregory Anderson Gregory Anderson, right, said planning his Disney World proposal to fianc√© Craig Moss was "magically stressful." 
‚ÄúTrying to decide where in Disney World I wanted to do it was difficult because I didn‚Äôt want to be obvious and I kept changing my mind,‚Äù Anderson told The Huffington Post. ‚ÄúHis mum had known for ages, too, and she kept messaging throughout the holiday asking when I was going to do it ‚Äï so I had to lie to Craig about who I was on the phone to. It was all magically stressful!‚Äù 
Disney-themed proposals , of course, are nothing new. Still, it‚Äôs particularly heartwarming to see a same-sex couple reaffirm their love with the Magic Kingdom as their backdrop. With that in mind, Anderson hopes his proposal video, which currently has over 7,000 views after being posted on Gay Star News , Instinct Magazine and other media outlets , and photos inspire other LGBTQ people to pursue their own ‚Äúhappily ever after.‚Äù Gregory Anderson "If you‚Äôre a Disney geek, embrace it," Anderson (right) said. 
‚ÄúI used to believe that every relationship had arguments and fights, that if you had a passion for something you should tone it down in order to be accepted by your LGBTQ peers,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was so unhappy trying to fit into the gay scene, that it took me a while to discover a whole new world of self-appreciation. If you‚Äôre a Disney geek, embrace it! Someday you‚Äôll find someone just like you who you‚Äôll never fight or argue with and don‚Äôt ever settle for less!‚Äù 
The couple are planning a 2018 wedding. Naturally, the ceremony will include a few nods to Disney. ‚ÄúI have it in my head that it‚Äôll be set up just like the ballroom scene in ‚ÄòBeauty and the Beast,‚Äô but that‚Äôll probably be a little over budget,‚Äù Anderson quipped. 
Congrats, gentlemen! Gregory Anderson The couple plan to tie the knot in 2018. 
For the latest news that matters to the LGBTQ community, don‚Äôt miss the Queer Voices newsletter . Also on HuffPost
